description: Create an IPAM. Amazon VPC IP Address Manager (IPAM) is a VPC feature that you can use to automate your IP address management workflows including assigning, tracking, troubleshooting, and auditing IP addresses across Amazon Web Services Regions and accounts throughout your Amazon Web Services Organization. For more information, see Create an IPAM in the Amazon VPC IPAM User Guide.

parameters.name: OperatingRegions
parameters.description: The operating Regions for the IPAM. Operating Regions are Amazon Web Services Regions where the IPAM is allowed to manage IP address CIDRs. IPAM only discovers and monitors resources in the Amazon Web Services Regions you select as operating Regions. For more information about operating Regions, see Create an IPAM in the Amazon VPC IPAM User Guide. (dict) --- Add an operating Region to an IPAM. RegionName (string) --- The name of the operating Region.

nested_params.name: RegionName
nested_params.description: The name of the operating Region.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: MeteredAccount
parameters.description: A metered account is an Amazon Web Services account that is charged for active IP addresses managed in IPAM. For more information, see Enable cost distribution in the Amazon VPC IPAM User Guide. Possible values: ipam-owner (default): The Amazon Web Services account which owns the IPAM is charged for all active IP addresses managed in IPAM. resource-owner: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the IP address is charged for the active IP address.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the owner of the IPAM.

nested_items.name: IpamId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IPAM.

nested_items.name: IpamArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IPAM.

nested_items.name: IpamRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the IPAM.

nested_items.name: PublicDefaultScopeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IPAM's default public scope.

nested_items.name: PrivateDefaultScopeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IPAM's default private scope.

nested_items.name: ScopeCount
nested_items.description: The number of scopes in the IPAM. The scope quota is 5. For more information on quotas, see Quotas in IPAM in the Amazon VPC IPAM User Guide.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the IPAM.

nested_items.name: OperatingRegions
nested_items.description: The operating Regions for an IPAM. Operating Regions are Amazon Web Services Regions where the IPAM is allowed to manage IP address CIDRs. IPAM only discovers and monitors resources in the Amazon Web Services Regions you select as operating Regions.

nested_items.name: RegionName
nested_items.description: The name of the operating Region.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the IPAM.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: DefaultResourceDiscoveryId
nested_items.description: The IPAM's default resource discovery ID.

nested_items.name: DefaultResourceDiscoveryAssociationId
nested_items.description: The IPAM's default resource discovery association ID.

nested_items.name: ResourceDiscoveryAssociationCount
nested_items.description: The IPAM's resource discovery association count.

nested_items.name: StateMessage
nested_items.description: The state message.

nested_items.name: Tier
nested_items.description: IPAM is offered in a Free Tier and an Advanced Tier. For more information about the features available in each tier and the costs associated with the tiers, see Amazon VPC pricing > IPAM tab.

nested_items.name: EnablePrivateGua
nested_items.description: Enable this option to use your own GUA ranges as private IPv6 addresses. This option is disabled by default.

nested_items.name: MeteredAccount
nested_items.description: A metered account is an Amazon Web Services account that is charged for active IP addresses managed in IPAM. For more information, see Enable cost distribution in the Amazon VPC IPAM User Guide.
ipam-owner (default): The Amazon Web Services account which owns the IPAM is charged for all active IP addresses managed in IPAM.
resource-owner: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the IP address is charged for the active IP address.
